review: I have this a roku 3, chromecast and now this.The roku was easy to set up.  Plenty of channels.  The best part is that it has a headphone jack which allows you watch/listen to a tv show and do the dishes late at night without having the tv way too loud.Chromecast.Most difficult to set up.  Has the worst quality.  I bought this so I can watch nfl rewind.Fire TVPerfect for plex.  If anyone has Plex I would get this.  The voice searching works most of the time, if it doesn't work the first time it'll work the second time.  2 voice searches is faster than any other type of searching.  My 4 year-old can search for Curious George!I understand that the roku has more channels but this had all I needed.

review: The speed of downloads is super. The ease of navigation and setup is very good. The remote works well, but I still am going to see if my Logitech universal remote works as well.
author: DEguy

review: This device is a good deal. Provides access to a wide range of Amazon videos and movies and if u have Amazon Prime many shows are free. While the coverage is not as extensive as what u get with Apple iTunes (for xample YouTube is not offered) you have access to Netflix and Hulu+. However, Amazon offerings are quite extensive, especially movies and streaming video and, I might add, the Amazon remote is a bit easier to use than the one provided with Apple. In conclusion I think that Amazon Fire TV has a slight edge over apple especially for customers who have Amazon Prime.

review: My mother loves it. She binge-watched House of Cards in two days. The set up was easy, even though Netflix gave her a little trouble (there was a system update required). She was hesitant about using the voice search, but after easily finding her shows, she loves it. She's now considering giving up her $215/mo cable.
